items.title: Samsung’s $4.5b Q1 profit outpaces forecasts despite setback
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics reported a preliminary operating profit of 6.6 trillion won (US$4.5 billion) for Q1 2025, exceeding expectations.
- The profit surge is attributed to strong demand for Galaxy S25 smartphones and existing DRAM products.
- Samsung faces challenges in the high-bandwidth memory (HBM) segment, lagging behind competitors like SK Hynix.
- The company plans to launch new HBM3E and HBM4 chips later this year despite tighter US chip export rules impacting sales in China.
- Analysts note that unusual customer stockpiling amid geopolitical tensions contributed to Samsung's Q1 performance.
- Samsung has segmented a critical share of its HBM sales to Chinese customers, which are now threatened by export restrictions.
- Samsung's successful Galaxy S25 launch helped stabilize revenues despite declines in DRAM and NAND flash prices.
- The company's quarterly revenue rose approximately 10% to 79 trillion won due to robust smartphone sales, but analysts warn of declining market growth ahead.

items.title: Driving Asia’s growth: Public-private partnerships in action
items.summary:
- The article discusses the significance of public-private partnerships (PPPs) in driving economic growth in Asia.
- Highlights three successful PPP projects: Keppel Seghers Tuas Waste-to-Energy Plant in Singapore, Trans Java Toll Road in Indonesia, and AsiaWorld-Expo in Hong Kong.
- Each project illustrates the collaboration between government and private sectors to achieve mutual benefits and address infrastructure and service challenges.
- The International Monetary Fund revised Asia's growth forecast for 2024 from 4.2% to 4.5%, emphasizing the role of PPPs in sustaining this growth.

items.title: Apple iPhone sales jump on tariff price fears
items.summary:
- Apple experienced a surge in customer traffic at US retail stores as shoppers rushed to buy iPhones, spurred by fears of tariff-induced price hikes.
- A proposed 54% tariff on Chinese products raised customer concerns about future iPhone prices, leading to increased sales.
- Apple is transitioning production from China to India and Vietnam to mitigate tariff impacts, while its stock has dropped over $500 billion.
- Panic buying reflects a historical pattern during tariff announcements, with consumers acting to prevent anticipated price increases.
- Apple's multi-country supply chain strategy faces challenges due to simultaneous tariffs on multiple production locations, affecting its risk mitigation efforts.
- The company is likely to absorb some of the tariff costs rather than passing them fully to consumers, similar to strategies used during previous tariff implementations.

items.title: Grab unveils new family, food, travel features
items.summary:
- Grab introduced 'Grab for Family | Teens' allowing teenagers to book rides from May 2025 with safety measures.
- 'GrabFood for One' launched, offering no minimum order and low delivery fees for individual users.
- 'Shared Saver' feature reduces delivery costs by allowing users to join live food orders, piloted in Singapore in April.
- New 'Advance Booking (Airport Pickup)' adjusts rides based on flight statuses, available at select Southeast Asian airports.
- 'Dine Out Discovery' helps users find dining options and promotions nearby.
- The 'Travel Pass' offers vouchers for airport rides and dining across Southeast Asia.

items.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange implements 30-minute trading halt
items.summary:
- The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) implemented a temporary trading halt on Apr. 8, 2025, after the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) dropped by 9.19% to 5,912.
- The halt lasted from 9:00 AM to 9:30 AM Jakarta time, triggered by a fall of more than 8% in accordance with updated policy.
- As of the morning, transaction value was IDR 1.92 trillion (US$ 114 million), with 9 stocks gaining, 552 declining, and 65 unchanged.
- The market capitalization of the IHSG was recorded at IDR 10,219 trillion (US$ 607.2 million).

items.title: Indian beauty brand bags $15.8m series B
items.author: Rohit Chawla, Sifat Khurana, Vimal Bhola
items.summary:
- Indian beauty brand Innovist raised 136 crore rupees (around US$15.8 million) in a series B funding round.
- Funding led by ICICI Venture with participation from Mirabilis Investment Trust, Niveshaay Investment, and Sauce.vc.
- Early investor Accel exited through a secondary transaction; specific details undisclosed.
- Funds will be utilized for product innovation, market expansion, and team growth.
- Founded in 2018, Innovist offers products under Bare Anatomy, Chemist at Play, SunScoop, and Vinci Botanicals.
- Innovist reported revenue exceeding 300 crore rupees (US$34.92 million) for FY25.

items.title: Grab launches AI tools for businesses, drivers in SEA
items.summary:

- The AI Merchant Assistant provides small businesses with operational insights and sales recommendations through the GrabMerchant app.
- The AI Driver Companion includes ride guidance to predict high-demand areas and a voice reporting feature for improved road condition reporting, enhancing GrabMaps accuracy.

items.title: Ex-Binance CEO joins Pakistan Crypto Council as advisor
items.summary:
- Former Binance CEO Changpeng ‘CZ’ Zhao appointed as strategic advisor to the Pakistan Crypto Council.
- The council, formed in March 2025, oversees blockchain and crypto initiatives in Pakistan.
- Zhao will advise on crypto infrastructure, education, and adoption.
- His involvement follows a guilty plea in 2023 for violating the Bank Secrecy Act.
- The initiative aims to grow Pakistan’s blockchain industry and attract international investment, providing regulatory clarity and institutional adoption.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 launches June 5 for $449.99
items.summary:
- Nintendo announces the Switch 2 launching on **June 5** for **$449.99**, a **50% increase** from the original Switch's price.
- The new console features a **larger screen, updated controllers**, and improved performance.
- Launch titles include **Mario Kart World**, **Donkey Kong Bananza**, **Street Fighter 6**, **The Duskbloods**, and **Kirby Air Riders**.
- Preorders have been delayed due to **trade-related tariffs** from the US administration.
- Nintendo has not disclosed the long-term effects of the tariffs on console pricing.

items.title: Google’s AI Answers Hurt Traffic for Small Publishers
items.summary:
- Google’s AI-driven answers have significantly disrupted traffic for independent website publishers.
- Reports indicate that some publishers have lost over 70% of their traffic, leading to reduced ad revenue and site closures.
- Google attributes the decline to factors like changing user behavior, not just AI features, despite a study showing consistent drops in small to mid-sized sites in various sectors.
- The travel sector has been particularly hard hit, with significant declines correlated with Google’s AI implementations.
- Publishers report that Google's changes appear to favor larger media brands, questioning the sustainability of this model for smaller sites.
- There is a historical pattern of algorithm changes causing business disruptions, highlighting vulnerability for content creators dependent on single platforms.
- The situation creates a “tragedy of the commons” where the quality and diversity of content could deteriorate due to decreased traffic and revenue for original creators.

items.title: Cassava, Nvidia to spend $720m on Africa’s first AI factory
items.author: Strive Masiyiwa
items.summary:
- Cassava Technologies to invest up to $720 million in Africa's first AI factory in partnership with Nvidia Corporation.
- The facility will include AI-powered data centers in multiple African countries: South Africa, Egypt, Nigeria, Kenya, and Morocco.
- The project begins in South Africa with installation of 3,000 Nvidia GPUs by June 2025, aiming for a total of 12,000 GPUs across the continent in the next 3-4 years, each costing $45,000 - $60,000.
- The AI factory will support various sectors including healthcare and fintech, and also sell excess capacity to Nvidia’s global clients.
- CEO Hardy Pemhiwa emphasized the need for early investment to maintain competitiveness in the AI sector.

items.title: Trump threatens new 50% tariffs on China
items.summary:
- President Trump plans to impose a new 50% tariff on China effective Apr. 9 unless China rescinds its recent tariff increases by Apr. 8.
- The new tariffs follow a 34% increase in Chinese tariffs on U.S. goods, raising the average U.S. tariff rate to 22.5%, the highest since 1909.
- Projected consumer price increase due to tariffs is 2.3%, resulting in an average loss of $3,800 per household, with lower-income households facing greater burdens.
- U.S. GDP growth expected to decline by 0.5%, and the manufacturing sector, especially automotive, will likely be hardest hit.
- Global markets have plummeted in response to tariff announcements, reflecting fears of disrupted supply chains and slower growth.

items.title: Duolingo joins $9.5m seed round of AI edtech startup

- Co-led by The House Fund and GSV Ventures, with participation from Duolingo, General Catalyst India, and others.
- Funds will improve AI models for Indian language learning and expand teams in India.
- SigIQ.ai aims to solve the “two sigma problem” in education by providing personalized learning at a reduced cost.
- The global EdTech market is projected to grow to $11.6 billion by 2025, with significant investment trends in AI education.
- Balances AI advancement with educational equity concerns, emphasizing data privacy and the risk of widening the digital divide.

items.title: Apple raises iPhone exports from India in March
items.summary:
- Apple increased iPhone exports from India to INR 20,000 crore (US$ 2.3 billion) in March 2025, up from INR 11,000 crore (US$ 1.28 billion) year-over-year.
- The rise in exports aims to build inventory ahead of new US tariffs effective April 2, 2025, including a 10% baseline duty and an additional 26% tariff on Indian goods starting April 9, 2025.
- In FY25, Apple’s vendors exported iPhones worth nearly INR 1.5 lakh crore (US$ 1.75 trillion), surpassing India’s total smartphone exports in FY24 of INR 1.3 lakh crore (US$ 1.5 trillion).

items.author: Dione Song

- The brand expects to achieve over US$75 million in revenue and EBITDA profitability by 2025.
- In October 2024, the company laid off 7% of its workforce, including roles in Singapore.
- Love Bonito has expanded regionally, reopening a store in Jakarta and opening a flagship store in Hong Kong in 2023.
- The company entered the Philippines with two new branches in 2024, contrasting with the trend of Singaporean D2C brands favoring development in the US.

items.title: BYD unveils two high-speed flagship EV models
items.summary:

- Teaser video released on Apr. 6 showcases design and performance advancements.
- Both models feature a new 1000V high-voltage platform for enhanced drivetrain and charging.
- Vehicles can accelerate from 0 to 100 km/h in just over 2 seconds.
- Ultra-fast charging adds 400 kilometers of range in approximately 5 minutes.
- Han L priced starting at ¥270,000 (US$37,300); Tang L starts at ¥360,000 (US$49,700).
- Designed to compete with Tesla’s Model S and Model X in global markets.

items.title: Tether considers US stablecoin for institutions
items.summary:

- The decision is influenced by a favorable regulatory environment and potential changes in US law, including a stablecoin bill in Congress.
- CEO Paolo Ardoino stated they are awaiting the final wording of the bill before proceeding.

- Managing partner Amit Mehta stated that fundraising is on track despite rigorous diligence from large institutions.
- Asha Ventures, founded in 2015, invests in companies like Adda 24×7, Vaastu, Avanti, and Nepra.

items.title: Grab’s cab comeback
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- Grab has re-entered the taxi business in Singapore after securing a license from the transport regulator.
- This move follows a failed acquisition of Trans-cab due to regulatory concerns about competition law.
- With this licensing, Grab becomes the sixth taxi company in Singapore and aims to become a major player in the market.
